content.description: Start left of the huecos next to a sage bush. Follow the huecos slightly left then move right into the vertical crack system. Take the crack and adjacent slab to the top.
content.protection: Lot of options to place gear for TR anchor. Can be done as highball as well.
content.location: Directly to the left of sage bush at base of wall. Approx 11ft to the right of the nose.

content.description: Start in the shallow alcove to the right of the nose. Climb up to the left until you reach the yellow colored patch of rocks then tend back right onto the more positive slab/wash to the top.
content.protection: Lots of options to place gear for TR anchor on top. Can also be potentially done as a highball.
content.location: Approx 8ft to the right of the nose. Starts in the shallow alcove with a 2ft vertical crack in its right side.

content.description: The easternmost formation (left if you are facing the crag from the access road). Most climbs are on the NW face with lots of options for protecting anchors on the top of the formation. Easy walk off to the left of the main face, follow the washes up.
